nodes.text: mathematicians recognize that the idea of an actually infinite number of things leads to self-contradictions
For example what is infinity minus infinity?

David Hilbert perhaps the greatest mathematician of this century states  The infinite is nowhere to be found in reality. It neither exists in nature nor provides a legitimate basis for rational thought.... The role that remains for the infinite to play is solely that of an idea....
God provides the best explanation for why the universe exists instead of nothing
There is not an explanation alternative to God
typically atheists have said that the universe is eternal and that's all. But surely this is unreasonable
The universe has begun to exist
An alternative explanation of the existence of the universe is not known
If the universe never had a beginning then that means that the number of past events is infinite.
This shows that infinity is just an idea in your mind not something that actually exists in reality.
But that entails that since past events are not just ideas in your mind but are real the number of past events must be finite.
Therefore the series of past events can't go back forever; rather the universe must have begun to exist.
